Name: Radio Group
Description: A set of checkable buttons—known as radio buttons—where no more than one of the buttons can be checked at a time.

SubComponentData.Name: Root
SubComponentData.Description: Contains all the parts of a radio group.

PropData.Name: asChild
PropData.Description: Change the default rendered element for the one passed as a child, merging their props and behavior.  Read our Composition guide for more details.

PropData.Name: defaultValue
PropData.Description: The value of the radio item that should be checked when initially rendered. Use when you do not need to control the state of the radio items.

PropData.Name: value
PropData.Description: The controlled value of the radio item to check. Should be used in conjunction with onValueChange.

PropData.Name: onValueChange
PropData.Description: Event handler called when the value changes.

PropData.Name: disabled
PropData.Description: Event handler called when the value changes.

PropData.Name: name
PropData.Description: The name of the group. Submitted with its owning form as part of a name/value pair.

PropData.Name: required
PropData.Description: When true, indicates that the user must check a radio item before the owning form can be submitted.

PropData.Name: loop
PropData.Description: The reading direction of the radio group. If omitted, inherits globally from DirectionProvider or assumes LTR (left-to-right) reading mode.

SubComponentData.Name: Item
SubComponentData.Description: An item in the group that can be checked. An input will also render when used within a form to ensure events propagate correctly.

PropData.Name: asChild
PropData.Description: Change the default rendered element for the one passed as a child, merging their props and behavior.  Read our Composition guide for more details.

PropData.Name: value
PropData.Description: The value given as data when submitted with a name.

PropData.Name: disabled
PropData.Description: When true, prevents the user from interacting with the radio item.

PropData.Name: required
PropData.Description: When true, indicates that the user must check the radio item before the owning form can be submitted.

SubComponentData.Name: Indicator
SubComponentData.Description: Renders when the radio item is in a checked state. You can style this element directly, or you can use it as a wrapper to put an icon into, or both.

PropData.Name: asChild
PropData.Description: Change the default rendered element for the one passed as a child, merging their props and behavior.  Read our Composition guide for more details.

PropData.Name: forceMount
PropData.Description: Used to force mounting when more control is needed. Useful when controlling animation with React animation libraries.
